page.title: 04FARM STOCK AND CROPS
page.content: {Stock}carried are dairy cattle and beef cattle, mostly Friesians or dairy and Friesian-Hereford cows and continental type beef cattle. Few pigs, few poultry and some breeding sheep. Most farms have their own minimum of 2 tractors with cabs, a baler and a combine harvester and a good range of cultivation machinery. {Crops}grown include grass for grazing, for silage and for hay. Wheat, oats, barley - both winter and spring varieties some potatoes, some kale and a little maize and oil seed rape. 1985 summer was the coldest and wettest in living memory.
